abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
snippet: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions.
lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation is in talks with Microsoft about joining in its contested bid for Yahoo, according to people involved in the discussions. The combination, which would join Yahoo, Microsoft’s MSN and News Corporation’s MySpace, would create a behemoth that would upend the Internet landscape.

headline.main: News Corp. May Join Yahoo Bid With Microsoft
headline.print_headline: In Twist, News Corp. Is Talking to Microsoft on Yahoo Bid

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Miguel Helft

abstract: Google, News Corporation, Time Warner: Some of the biggest players in media and tech are being swept up in the Yahoo takeover battle. The new twists have riveted Wall Street and Silicon Valley, but how much do they alter the balance of power?
lead_paragraph: Google, News Corporation, Time Warner: Some of the biggest players in media and tech are being swept up in the Yahoo takeover battle. The new twists have riveted Wall Street and Silicon Valley, but how much do they alter the balance of power?

abstract: It’s just a two-week trial that involves a thin sliver of Yahoo‘s search business in the United States. But Yahoo’s experiment with Google, announced late Wednesday, has some Wall Street analysts seeing big dollar signs.
lead_paragraph: It’s just a two-week trial that involves a thin sliver of Yahoo‘s search business in the United States. But Yahoo’s experiment with Google, announced late Wednesday, has some Wall Street analysts seeing big dollar signs.

abstract: Look who Google‘s turned to for help.
lead_paragraph: Look who Google‘s turned to for help.

headline.main: Google Taps Quattrone to Advise on Yahoo

abstract: What if Microsoft dropped its bid for Yahoo and bought AOL and MySpace instead? One analyst says that may be a better deal than a target that doesn’t want to merge.
snippet: What if Microsoft dropped its bid for Yahoo and bought AOL and MySpace instead? One analyst says that may be a better deal than a target that doesn’t want to merge.
lead_paragraph: The flirtations and betrayals among Internet giants would steam up even the hottest afternoon soap opera. In the latest round, the News Corporation, which had been playing footsie with Yahoo, has jumped into the arms of Microsoft in an effort to break up the pending union of Yahoo and Time Warner’s estranged wife, AOL. Oh yes, Google, which everyone envies, is prodding all this on to keep its rivals in a state of confusion.

headline.main: Is Yahoo the Odd Man Out?
